intro: Martinella insculpta, commonly known as the ridged mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves with prominent veins and ridges. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a showy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
